Description: Limestone canopic jar with flat base and flaring sides, drawn in at shoulder, with panel containing four vertical registers of black-painted hieroglyphs on front; the cover is human-headed, representing Imsety, with details of eyes and eye-brows painted black.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1992 Jul-Oct, Norfolk, Swaffham Museum, Ancient Egypt 1993-2003, Newcastle, The Hancock Museum, Land of the Pharaohs 2006/8 Sept-Sept, Wallsend, Segedunum Roman Fort & Baths Museum, Egypt Revealed
